NOTES:
* provider: This version is built using Go 1.14.5, including security fixes to the crypto/x509 and net/http packages.
BREAKING CHANGES

provider: New versions of the provider can only be automatically installed on Terraform 0.12 and later (link)
provider: All "removed" attributes are cut, using them would result in a Terraform Core level error (link)
provider: Credential ordering has changed from static, environment, shared credentials, EC2 metadata, default AWS Go SDK (shared configuration, web identity, ECS, EC2 Metadata) to static, environment, shared credentials, default AWS Go SDK (shared configuration, web identity, ECS, EC2 Metadata) (link)
provider: The module environment variable no longer has any effect as we now depend on the default AWS Go SDK EC2 Metadata client timeout of one second with two retries (link)
provider: Remove deprecated module and module custom service endpoint arguments (link)
data-source/aws_availability_zones: Remove deprecated module and module arguments (link)
data-source/aws_directory_service_directory: Return an error when a single result is not found (link)
data-source/aws_ecr_repository: Return an error when a single result is not found (link)
data-source/aws_efs_file_system: Return an error when a single result is not found (link)
data-source/aws_launch_template: Return an error when a single result is not found (link)
data-source/aws_route53_resolver_rule: Trailing period removed from module argument set in data-source (link)
data-source/aws_route53_zone: Trailing period removed from module argument set in data-source (link)
resource/aws_acm_certificate: module, module, and module attributes are no longer stored in the Terraform state with hash values (link)
resource/aws_acm_certificate: module attribute changed from list to set (link)
resource/aws_acm_certificate: Plan-time validation added to module and module arguments to prevent usage of strings with trailing periods (link)
resource/aws_api_gateway_method_settings: Remove module property from module and module arguments, enabling drift detection (link)
resource/aws_api_gateway_method_settings: Update module and module argument defaults to match API default of module to keep throttling disabled (link)
resource/aws_autoscaling_group: module and module argument conflict now reported at plan-time (link)
resource/aws_autoscaling_group: Remove module property from module and module arguments, enabling drift detection (link)
resource/aws_cloudfront_distribution: module argument renamed to module to support accessing module in Terraform 0.12 (link)
resource/aws_cloudwatch_log_group: Automatically trim module suffix from module attribute (link)
resource/aws_codepipeline: Removes module environment variable (link)
resource/aws_cognito_user_pool: Remove deprecated module configuration block module argument (link)
resource/aws_dx_gateway: Remove automatic module resource import (link)

resource/aws_ebs_volume: Return an error when module argument set to a value greater than 0 for volume types other than module (link)
resource/aws_elastic_transcoder_preset: Remove module configuration block module argument default value (link)
resource/aws_emr_cluster: Remove deprecated module configuration block, module, module, and module arguments (link)
resource/aws_glue_job: Remove deprecated module argument (link)
resource/aws_iam_access_key: Remove deprecated module attribute (link)

provider: Region validation now automatically supports the new module (Africa (Cape Town)) region. NOTES:

provider: The default development, testing, and building of the Terraform AWS Provider binary is now done with Go 1.13. This version of Go now requires macOS 10.11 El Capitan or later and FreeBSD 11.2 or later. Support for previous versions of those operating systems has been discontinued. (link)
provider: The actual Terraform version running the provider will now be included the AWS Go SDK module headers for Terraform 0.12 and later. Terraform 0.11 and earlier will use module as this information was not accessible in those versions. Previously, the Terraform version in the module header was based on the github.com/hashicorp/terraform dependency in the provider codebase. (link)
